alert.note: Alert for Allen; Grant; Huntington; Noble; Wells; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 1:49PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Allen, southeastern Noble, northeastern Grant, southeastern Whitley, Huntington and northern Wells Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 148 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Huntington to 10 miles southwest of Markle to near Van Buren. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Huntington around 155 PM EDT. Markle around 205 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fort Wayne and Ossian. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 269 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Grant; Huntington; Noble; Wells; Whitley
